awd_titl_txt: IUCRC for Pyrolitic Synthesis of Aluminum Nitride via Fluid Bed Calcination of Metal Organic Precursors
awd_abstract_narration: This Research Opportunity Award funds a primarily Hispanic                 institution, the City College of the City University of New York,               to collaborate with Rutgers University Cooperative Research Center              for Ceramics.  The two year collaborative project is "Pyrolitic                 Synthesis of Aluminum Nitride via Fluid Bed Calcination of Metal-               Organic Precursors" has been requested by the Center's Industry                 Advisory Board.                                                                      Rutgers University research team will synthesize and granulate             aluminum nitride polymeric resins that City College will calcine                in a high temperature fluidization laboratory.                                       The Program Manager recommends the City College of the City                University of New York be awarded $100,000 for two years as a                   Research Opportunity Award.
org_div_long_name: Division of Engineering Education and Centers

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RESEARCH FOUNDATION OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
